content.description: This is a splitter boulder problem beginning with tight fingers on slightly slabby terrain, then slowly kicking back and widening until a small bulge where it turns to tight/thin hands. Really awesome finger locks in the middle third of the problem. Have attentive spotters and a well-thought out plan for your pads, because a fall from the top could hurt (about a 20+ foot fall, unless you fall into the pit...). Harder for people with big paws. This thing is classic, with fun movement, good rock, an engaging mental crux, exhilarating for the grade, aesthetic and amazing views from the top out.
content.protection: Pads and spotters. 3+ pads would be ideal.
content.location: GPS coordinates are: 39.3395130, -105.2680610. It faces south.

content.description: Start underclinging a bulging flake, and work your way up and around it to gain the slopey topout. This is really fun, but to gain the start, you need to stack some pads.
content.location:
It is right in front of

Shake It Off (aka Shotgun Express)

.

climbs.name: Buffalo Creek Bangerz (aka One Last Fix)

content.description: This is a nice, tall, hands boulder problem that makes a great warm-up for the other crack boulders in the area. Crux is down low.
content.location:
It is 10 yards to the right of "

Shotgun Express

."

content.description: Sit start on some flaring hands, and work your way up through some handcracky, flarey weirdness! There is a bit of crumbly rock on this one.
content.location:
It is to the right of

Buffalo Creek Bangerz

.
